page.title: 14Architecture in Sth Benfleet
page.content: South Benfleet can boast one house in pure Modern Movement style built in 1937 to the design of the well known architect Wells Coates. It is said to be modelled on Le Corbusier's Villa Savoye and is now listed.The Modern Movement influenced design in the post_war period mostly in public buildings,such as Appleton and Kents Hill Schools and some large Shopping Arcades along the High Road.A few private houses can be seen in Kents Hill Road,but the troublesome flat roofs are not popular.The Sixth Form College and adjacent Council Offices also echo Bauhaus_Expressionist idea of a crowning crystalline roof.The once flat_roofed rectangular Runnymede Civic Hall was enclosed in a steelframe last year and has now the appearance of a huge Saxon Hall.
